description: This chatbot serves the IBM Data Analytics team to get to know more on IBM Cloud Private (ICP)

values: Helm is an open source that streamlines installing and managing Kubernetes applications. Helm performs packaging formatting using Helm charts. Helm chart is a collection of files that describe a related set of Kubernetes resources.
In Kubernetes structure, a cluster is a group of nodes.
Helm is an open source that streamlines installing and managing Kubernetes applications.
A node is the smallest unit of computing hardware in Kubernetes. It is a representation of a single machine in a Kubernetes cluster.
Pods are used as the unit of replication in Kubernetes. It is useful when the application scales for load balancing.
I understand you want to know something related Kubernetes. Can you please reword your statement?
Kubernetes is an open-source container-orchestration platform for automating deployment, scaling and management of containerized applications.

Public clouds are owned and operated by companies that offer rapid access over a public network to affordable computing resources. Private cloud is a cloud computing model operated solely for a single organization. ICP on the other hand, is a Container-based platform for developing and managing on-premise, containerized applications. Allows you to design, develop, deploy and manage on-premises containerized cloud applications behind a firewall.

Public clouds are owned and operated by companies that offer rapid access over a public network to affordable computing resources. With public cloud services, users don’t need to purchase hardware, software, or supporting infrastructure, which is owned and managed by providers. ICP on the other hand, is a Container-based platform for developing and managing on-premise, containerized applications. Allows you to design, develop, deploy and manage on-premises containerized cloud applications behind a firewall.

ICP for Data is built on ICP and provides you with an integrated end to end governed data and analytics solution.  ICP for Data is infused throughout with automation, collaboration, and governance to give you a modern enterprise platform using machine learning  and artificial intelligence capabilities. However, Public clouds are owned and operated by companies that offer rapid access over a public network to affordable computing resources. With public cloud services, users don’t need to purchase hardware, software, or supporting infrastructure, which is owned and managed by providers.

ICP for Data is built on ICP and provides you with an integrated end to end governed data and analytics solution.  ICP for Data is infused throughout with automation, collaboration, and governance to give you a modern enterprise platform using machine learning  and artificial intelligence capabilities. Private cloud on the other hand,  is a cloud computing model operated solely for a single organization. It can be hosted behind the company firewall or externally.
I understand you want to know something related cloud models. Can you please reword your statement?

ICP is an application platform for developing and managing on-premises, containerized applications.  ICP for Data provides you with an integrated end to end governed data and analytics solution.  Moreover, ICP for Data is infused throughout with automation, collaboration, and governance to give you a modern enterprise platform using machine learning  and artificial intelligence capabilities.

Private cloud is a cloud computing model operated solely for a single organization. It can be hosted behind the company firewall or externally. A private cloud allows companies to customize their environments according to their unique needs and security requirements. ICP on the other hand, is a Container-based platform for developing and managing on-premise, containerized applications. Allows you to design, develop, deploy and manage on-premises containerized cloud applications behind a firewall.

Public clouds are owned and operated by companies that offer rapid access over a public network to affordable computing resources. With public cloud services, users don’t need to purchase hardware, software, or supporting infrastructure, which is owned and managed by providers. Private clouds on the other hand, is a cloud computing model operated solely for a single organization.
The user personas addressed for ICP for data are  data engineers, data stewards and data scientists and system administrators within the enterprise.
I understand you want to know about ICP for data use cases. Can you please specify the persona you would like to know about?

Using ICP for data, a data scientist can find data of interest from all data in the enterprise, explore, visualize, transform and reshape data. They can also share analytics assets with other collaborators.

Using ICP for data, a system administrator can allocate and manage resource usage and scale as needed. They can provision quickly with the complete set of capabilities and monitor the health of the system.

Using ICP for data, a data steward can build  an enterprise catalog through auto-discover and classify all existing data sources. They can also visualize consumers of data and producers with lineage, metrics about assets being consumed and quality profiles.

Using ICP for data, a data engineer can achieve data virtualization best practices, create new IBM middleware databases and resources, build data movement and transformation flows to help prepare data for other users to consume.

generic.title: Top four use cases of ICP for Data are:

values: ICP for Data is built on ICP and provides you with an integrated end to end governed data and analytics solution. ICP for Data is infused throughout with automation, collaboration, and governance to give you a modern enterprise platform using machine learning and artificial intelligence capabilities. You can know more about ICP for Data through IBM internal page ICP for Data.
You can start using ICP by installing the free community edition on your machine. You can install the community edition through this link: IBM Cloud Private installation .

ICP has a lot of capabilities, here are some: it can offer and manage container as a service, platform as a service, and infrastructure as a service. It can also refactor legacy applications to be cloud native, address security and risk of your application, automate scaling of applications and integrates DevOps in application development.
ICP has three editions, the community, the cloud native and the enterprise edition. You can know more about the editions through ICP editions.
In a builder or community edition of ICP, ICP is used to create cloud native applications for non-production environments. It is also free and available on Docker Store.

dialog_nodes.title: ICP defination

values: ICP is a Container-based platform for developing and managing on-premise, containerized applications. Allows you to design, develop, deploy and manage on-premises containerized cloud applications behind a firewall. You can know more ICP through the internal IBM ICP Page ICP.

dialog_nodes.conditions: @defination:(ICP mean) || @ICP:ICP && @ICP_Price != 'ICP price' && @ICP != 'edition' && @ICP!= 'capabilities' && @ICP_Price != 'ICP Pricing and packaging' && @Calculator != 'pricing calculator' && @ICP != 'capabilities'

values: There are three main competitors for ICP: Microsoft, Oracle and SAS. To know more about ICP competition, please visit this link ICP competitors.
There exists no IBM competitor that has a platform equivalent to the IBM Cloud Private for Data.

Microsoft can position itself as a leader in Hybrid Cloud which has all of the capabilities which are included in ICP for Data. It does not have a single offering with these capabilities, but it’s message to customers could be that it’s data and analytics offerings are already well integrated. Given it’s public cloud focus, it is unlikely that Microsoft will combine these capabilities into a private cloud offering in the near future. To know more about what Microsoft provides, please visit Microsoft Vendor .
To know about the alternatives to ICP in the market, please check the following page ICP competitors.

Microsoft are different in terms of their strategy for Analytics starts with Azure platform. They use their platform to drive data gravity, and leverages large and entrenched customer bases to expand its footprint. Takes a unified approach to analytics and compared to most other vendors it has a robust set of analytics capabilities. To know more about what Microsoft provides, please visit Microsoft Vendor .

Microsoft strengths lies in the dominant position with must have offerings (Office, Windows, Azure) provide cross-sell/up-sell opportunities they have. Also, they focus on platform and ecosystem help Microsoft overcome  specific Analytics capability gaps, with more than 12 million developers and over 600 thousands developers.

dialog_nodes.title: Capabilities of microsoft data and analytics

values: Microsoft analytics involves several capabilities including: Data Science, ML Models and Deployments, Reporting, Discovery, Classification and Governance, Transformation Services, Policy Management and Database Management. To know more about Microsoft data capabilities please visit Microsoft Vendor .

I understand you want to know something related Microsoft. I can answer questions like Microsoft analytics, and how its different from ICP for data, and the strengths and weaknesses of their Data platform. Or alternatively, you can check about ICP and Microsoft competition through this link ICP competitors.

Microsoft lacks integration in amongst Azure Data Factory, data quality and  governance activities. They also have no on-prem equivalent for Data Factory and Data Catalog, and most importantly, customers would have to purchase multiple products to have equivalent capabilities to ICP for Data.

Microsoft supports three cloud deployments models; Public, Private, Hybrid. However, Microsoft’s strategic focus is Public Cloud, most of  its Data and Analytics offerings are available in public cloud only.

There exists no IBM competitor that has a platform equivalent to the IBM Cloud Private for Data. You can know more about the competitors through Competitors

.
ICP Foundations will come bundled in when a customer buys "ICP for Data". There is no need to procure ICP separately.
ICP supports many data services, some include IBM Db2, IBM Db2 Direct Advanced Edition, IBM Db2 Warehouse, IBM Db2 Warehouse Enterprise and IBM Cloudant Developer Edition.
ICP can support and can process any data sources and data formats of different types, whether structured or unstructured.
DB2 is a family of relational database management system products from IBM that serve a number of different operating system platforms.
The open source data services included in ICP is MongoDB PostgreSQL and Redis.

ICP data lab offerings include ICP for Data Solution Initiation workshop, followed by ICP for Data MVP Build and CP for Data Production Readiness. You can know more about the offerings by visiting this page: ICP offerings
Yes, ICP for data can work with Watson Studio. ICP for data can be integrated with Watson Studio for AI services development and management.

You can position ICP for Data to your customers  a new standalone offering that helps address three issues: First, make your data ready for AI: Integrated offering to quickly  access, govern and analyze  enterprise data at scale. Second, Private Cloud Adoption: Modernize data workloads leveraging cloud native benefits behind the firewall. Third, Modern Data Platform : Here you can manage  your enterprise data, to improve  operations and ensure compliance.

dialog_nodes.title: Capabilities of SAS data and analytics

values: SAS analytics involves several capabilities including: Data Science, ML Models and Deployments, Reporting, Discovery, Classification and Governance, Transformation Services, Policy Management and Database Management. To know more about SAS capabilities please visit SAS Vendor .

SAS is different mainly in embedding AI capabilities and enable automation across the SAS Platform, from data preparation and model building to model deployment. To know more about SAS capabilities please visit SAS Vendor .

I understand you want to know something related SAS. I can answer questions like SAS analytics, and how its different from ICP for data, and the strengths and weaknesses of their Data platform. Or alternatively, you can check about ICP and SAS competition through this link ICP competitors.

SAS is more inclined towards Advanced Analytics (predictive and ML) solution Have individual offerings in data governance space and partners that provide DM services over SAS solutions. SAS does not seem to combine these offerings and compete with IBM. To know more about SAS analytics capabilities please visit SAS Vendor .

SAS offers extensive Machine Learning algorithms in its platform and has offerings catered to DS, BA. It is a recognized as a leader in Data Science Platform, Data Integration and Data Quality Magic Quadrants; market share leader for advanced/predictive analytics (IDC).

SAS can provide  software custom-tailored to meet client needs  with the flexibility to be deployed  on-site or on a hosted or public cloud. SAS Viya is built to be elastic and scalable for both private and public cloud.
There exists no IBM competitor that has a platform equivalent to the IBM Cloud Private for Data.
SAS has minimal DM capabilities as SAS only talks of access, integrate and edit data. Data governance is a separate offering and not offered as a product of their Viya platform.

Using ICP for data, a data engineer can achieve data virtualization best practices, create new IBM middleware databases and resources, build data movement and transformation flows to help prepare data for other users to consume.

Using ICP for data, a data steward can build  an enterprise catalog through auto-discover and classify all existing data sources. They can also visualize consumers of data and producers with lineage, metrics about assets being consumed and quality profiles.

Using ICP for data, a system administrator can allocate and manage resource usage and scale as needed. They can provision quickly with the complete set of capabilities and monitor the health of the system.

Using ICP for data, a data scientist can find data of interest from all data in the enterprise, explore, visualize, transform and reshape data. They can also share analytics assets with other collaborators.
There exists no IBM competitor that has a platform equivalent to the IBM Cloud Private for Data.
Oracle platform weakness lies in their recent acquisition of DataScience.com will take some time to align and integrate to rest of Oracle offerings.

Oracle supports three cloud deployments models; Public, Private  (Cloud at Customer), and Hybrid deployments. Oracle cloud capabilities will be available in private cloud deployments through Oracle Cloud at Customer.

Oracle platform strength lies in their strong market position in RDBMS, expansive portfolio of governance & integration and data management solutions, with alignment to broader set of cloud services and applications.

I understand you want to know something related Oracle. I can answer questions like Oracle analytics, and how its different from ICP for data, and the strengths and weaknesses of their Data platform. Or alternatively, you can check about ICP and Oracle competition through this link ICP competitors.

Oracle is different in terms of: Largest market share of RDBMS, strong position across Data warehouse deployments. Also, their symmetry between public and private cloud offerings and their Autonomous Database & Security offerings. To know more about Oracle capabilities please visit Oracle Vendor .

dialog_nodes.title: Capabilities of oracle data and analytics

values: Oracle analytics involves several capabilities including: Data Science, ML Models and Deployments, Reporting, Discovery, Classification and Governance, Transformation Services, Policy Management and Database Management. To know more about Oracle data capabilities please visit Oracle Vendor .

Oracle will particularly appeal to customers committed to Oracle DB and/or Oracle stack solutions (e.g. enterprise applications). You can know more about Oracle analytics capabilities through Oracle Vendor .

With this partnership, IBM Cloud Private will be certified to run on the Red Hat OpenShift, an open-source container platform based on Docker and Kubernetes, so clients can lift and shift apps and get more workloads to the cloud.

ICP for Data has three editions, the community edition, the cloud native edition and the enterprise edition. You can know more about the editions through ICP for Data editions.
A cloud native edition is used to collect,  organize  and analyze data in production.
An enterprise edition of ICP for data involves full function deployments within an enterprise in a production environment.
A community edition of ICP for data is used to build and manage data and analytics in non-production environments.

Cloud native applications are applications that are built specifically for a cloud computing architecture. Cloud native is an approach to building and running applications that fully exploit the advantages of the cloud computing model.
You can install ICP for community edition or an enterprise edition. Please visit this link to install it on your machine ICP installation.
Open source technologies involved in ICP include: Docker, Kubernetes, Cloud Foundry and Helm.
Hadoop is an open source distributed processing framework that manages data processing and storage for big data applications running in clustered systems.
Yes, ICP will come bundled in when a customer buys ICP for Data. There is no need to procure ICP separately.
ICP is mainly built on three open source technologies: Docker, Kubernetes and Helm.

Virtual machines provides an abstract machine that uses device drivers targeting the abstract machine A container on the other hand, provides an abstract Operating System making it much lighter weight than a virtual machine.
I understand you want to know something related Microservices. Can you please reword your statement?

Microservices architecture - a variant of Software Oriented Architecture, is a software development technique that structures an application as a collection of loosely coupled, independently deployable services.

A monolithic architecture involves developing an application as a single unit. However, in a microservice architecture, the application is broken into several units, or services and are developed and deployed independent of each other.
Microservices is a software development technique that structures an application as a collection of loosely coupled, independently deployable services.

Microservices is a software development technique that structures an application as a collection of loosely coupled, independently deployable services. Containers on the other hand, is a lightweight, stand-alone, executable package of a piece of software that includes everything needed to run it: code, runtime, system tools, system libraries, settings.

A container  is a lightweight, stand-alone, executable package of a piece of software that includes everything needed to run it: code, runtime, system tools, system libraries, settings. Containers allows a software/program to run reliably in different computing environments different than the one that it was developed in. Docker is the open source tool used to manage the containers.
I understand you want to know something related Dockers. Can you please reword your statement?
Containers allows a software/program to run reliably in different computing environments different than the one that it was developed in. Docker is the open source tool used to manage the containers.
Docker is an open source tool designed to make it easier to create, deploy, and run applications by using containers.
A Dockerfile is a text document that contains all the instructions needed to create a container image. It assembles the commands the user would enter to create the container.
Docker is an open source tool designed to make it easier to create, deploy, and run applications by using containers.
